meanings.def: the way a surface, substance or piece of cloth feels when you touch it, for example how rough, smooth, hard or soft it is
examples: She uses a variety of different colours and textures in her wall hangings.
The method used will vary with the soil texture and climate.
The cloth was rough in texture.
She pays great attention to the surface texture of her paintings.

meanings.def: the way food or drink tastes or feels in your mouth, for example whether it is rough, smooth, light, heavy, etc.
examples: The two cheeses were very different in both taste and texture.
It's a pungent little wine with a velvety texture.
She enjoyed the rich texture of the beer.
Sponge cakes have a light texture.
the chewy texture of Portobello mushrooms

meanings.def: the way that different parts of a piece of music or literature are combined to create a final impression
examples: the rich texture of the symphony
a piece of music with a dense choral texture
